userreviews.userReview: Basically.

An interesting and meaningful idea in the confined space of a hundred words. What else to expect from Susan Ee?! Brilliance!You can read it here:http://www.wattpad.com/28811868-one-h...It's really that short. :)

What...!? Now that my daughter has finally stopped laughing at me, I can write this silly review that will probably be a lot longer than the actual story really is. I wasn't even going to write a review but we were laughing so hard at this that I felt compelled to do so.This literally is 100 words (well, I didn't actually count the words, but it really is that short.) I kept pressing the down arrow trying to read more and my daughter started laughing at me and finally had to tell me to stop. "Mom, stop! That's it. That's the end of the story." What, what do you mean!? Where's the rest of it? As soon as I realized that that really was all we both busted out laughing.Not sure why this would go on here or why it had such high reviews. Really, go read it and tell me it deserves four star reviews.

An interesting, simple yet complicated story. In my opinion, Susan Ee managed to give me chills and all kinds of creepy feelings climbed up my spines after reading this extremely short story. I was also quite confused at the same time; that's probably why I like it. With only 100 words, she undoubtedly nailed it.
Hitchcock-ish thing in just 100 words. Liked it.

That went completely over my head! 100 words just isn't enough for me to feel invested in a story so it completely missed the mark for me unfortunately.If anyone is interested you can read this for free on Wattpad though

userreviews.userName: Karlyflower *The Vampire Ninja, Luminescent Monster & Wendigo Nerd Goddess of Canada (according to The Hulk)*
userreviews.userReview: Everything isn't what it appears!A quick read but an interesting one!

what??? creepy
Uuuuhhh!Me gustan este tipo de historias "fractal", y creó suspenso en 100 palabras. Bien.(Si les gustó éste, lean el cuento Continuidad de los parques de Cortázar)
This is a 100 words. A 100 words of creepiness. I pray Susan Ee is at home writing a 1,000 page book right this minute! I WANT MORE!!!!
3.5 starsSo weird and creepy. Not really my thing, but it's only 100 words, and it was interesting.
For 100 words that was really good and creepy. :)
At just 100 words long this was too short for me to form an opinion either way.
Oooh, that creeped me out!
Best Halloween present ever! With a cover!
Only 100 words yet enough to mindfuck you. Simple, but effective. Me likey.
Not exactly Angelfall quality, but I'll take anything I can get while I'm waiting for End of Days ;-)
woah. this so SO cool. and creepy. and cooland am i the only one who actually counted the words though lmao.
İlginç. :D
Yüz kelimecik bir şeydi yahu, daha uzun bir şeyler okumak istiyorum Susan'dan. :(

I cannot bring myself to rate this, for how would you rate 100 words? It could have been a good way to start a longer story, perhaps 5k words or such, rather than just stopping after ... well, some sentences. It doesn't waste any time to read this, nor does it give you a "Yes, that was the story of the year" feeling. Well, that's probably obvious, but ... still.By the way, I'll never understand what's so interesting with writing 100 word drabbles. No story can be developed, no character introduced. Only an atmosphere. And that's something that lasts for merely five sentences before vanishing again with the story's end.

Susan Ee you never cease to amaze me.Creepy and paradoxial (is that a word?) as hell and the fact that she could make me feel like that with only one hundred words is too good guys, too good. Oh, and this has one hundred words, and it's called one hundred steps. I saw what you did there.You could read it here it's extremely short:http://www.wattpad.com/28811868-one-h...Yep, that's a hundred words.
What do you rate something that is 100 words long?
Mysterious continuum drabble.
An interesting idea and something that could have so much potential... It's truly amazing how something intriguing could be built in 100 words.
Mind Fuck.Read it.

description: Someone is following me. I only catch glimpses of a man in the shadows behind me whenever I steal a glance, but I know that something is wrong... In the tradition of UK drabbles, this is a story that is exactly 100 words.
title: One Hundred Steps
